example-learning-objective.text: Prose we want to show up in the lesson.
example-learning-objective.assessment-rec: author notes about how it might be assessed

example-objective.text: Prose we want to show up in the lesson.
example-objective.assessment-rec: author notes about how it might be assessed

machines-v-people.text: Understand that machines and people often use starkly different processes to complete identical tasks, based on the strengths and limitations of computers and human brains.

data-driven-algos.text: Define data-driven algorithms as the instructions that tell a computer how to perform a task, which produce better results when given more data.

training.text: Define training as the act of transforming data into a model, usually after aggregating the data in some way.

bag-of-words.text: Define a bag of words as a model that represents text as an unordered collection of words with frequencies.

data-normalization.text: Describe the importance of data normalization, organizing data to follow a standard pattern.

ai-vs-ml.text: Distinguish between artificial intelligence, technologies that enable computers to perform tasks that were once thought to be for humans only, and machine learning, a branch of artificial intelligence involving a set of algorithms.

slm.text: Apply statistical language modeling to predict the likelihood of various word sequences using statistical patterns in data.

predictive-text.text: Explain how predictive text AI relies on probability.

regression-ml.text: Describe how regression is one form of supervised machine learning

car-function.text: Describe the function that automated the steering of the very first self-driving car.

ai-effect.text: Describe the AI effect--the phenomenon where humans continuously redefine intelligence to exclude AI achievements .

ai-create-tree.text: Create a decision tree from a training dataset.

unsupervised-learning.text: Define unsupervised learning as a type of machine learning where algorithms learn patterns from unlabeled data.

reinforcement-learning.text: Define reinforcement learning as a type of machine learning where the machine agent learns how to maximize its performance through trial and error.
